We get it: You need to know what you're signing up for before you apply, right? This is what you need to know: As a Software Developer in Test Co-op, you'll be responsible for: • Testing changes to our software to ensure a high level of quality. • Reproducing problems reported by our customers. • Providing technical assistance to our customer success team. • Fixing bugs and implementing new test automation framework. • Reviewing code written by team members to maintain best practices and quality. Halfway through your co-op: • You have made several impactful code changes, they have been merged into the test suite. • You know our product well and can answer common technical questions about it. • You can test most changes and be confident you've identified any problems. • You've helped onboard new team members, sharing product and test automation knowledge to bring them up to speed. • Your work-term project is well underway. At the end of your co-op: • You are a fully contributing member of the development team. • You're the point person for tackling complex problems faced by the customer success team. • You've mastered our product and test suite, and are comfortable with the codebase. • Your work-term project is complete. Please note: This co-op is listed as ideally an 8-month co-op but we will consider a 4-month co-op with a 4-month work term to make up 8 months total.
